name: That was great sex!
description: Cigarette Stories is a captivating photography collection that immerses viewers in the complex world of smoking. Through a series of powerful visuals, it offers a thought-provoking exploration of the various facets of smoking.

name: Dead + Seared Mind
description: Man’s conscience has been seared with a hot iron. The state of our nation has brought people to the point where their conscience is completely dead and their lives hypocritical. A seared mind is darkened in its understanding and has lost all sensitivity to reality. Everything wrong is now normal and it’s ok.

name: Justice is coming
description: Why shed the blood of the innocent blood? Why bury the younger generation in the soil of your cruelty?Why kill our future leaders because they speak the truth? Is it because they stand up for the truth, or cos they demand their rights you’ve forcefully taken from them? Why do we silence their voices? Why do we celebrate corruption and praise mediocrity? Why do the leaders hate structure? Justice is coming. Be warned. The voices of the blood of the innocent have been heard.

name: Gas Fee
description: A nation so great, a nation so blessed, a nation so powerfully rich in natural resources is out of gas. The same substance that flows beneath the surface of this motherland. What is natural has become more scarce than what is artificial in our nation.

name: The Hold I
description: Our hands are a physical expression of our will and intention and society is a web of people who are consistently trying to hold each other to their expectations. To support or to stifle is the intention that will be felt by both sides of the coin. The viewpoint is a journey and lens one can choose as the viewer not just to question society but ultimately oneself.

name: The Hold II
description: Our hands are a physical expression of our will and intention and society is a web of people who are consistently trying to hold each other to their expectations. To support or to stifle is the intention that will be felt by both sides of the coin. The viewpoint is a journey and lens one can choose as the viewer not just to question society but ultimately oneself.

name: The Hold III
description: Our hands are a physical expression of our will and intention and society is a web of people who are consistently trying to hold each other to their expectations. To support or to stifle is the intention that will be felt by both sides of the coin. The viewpoint is a journey and lens one can choose as the viewer not just to question society but ultimately oneself.

name: Estelle
description: In a world where society tries to limit and contain us, see us as delusional or crazy. We can only go where the clouds take us. We can make that change or chase that dream even though society labels us. We are comfortable with those labels and how we are seen! We are comfortable with our ‘Heads in the clouds’.

name: Up There
description: In a world where society tries to limit and contain us, see us as delusional or crazy. We can only go where the clouds take us. We can make that change or chase that dream even though society labels us. We are comfortable with those labels and how we are seen! We are comfortable with our ‘Heads in the clouds’.

name: Together At Dusk
description: In a world where society tries to limit and contain us, see us as delusional or crazy. We can only go where the clouds take us. We can make that change or chase that dream even though society labels us. We are comfortable with those labels and how we are seen! We are comfortable with our ‘Heads in the clouds’.

name: Ozymandias
description: This piece is a metaphor for the ephemeral nature of political power. It centres on the citizens of Nigeria as a reflection of their habitually corrupt government and the insignificance of lives as a passage of time. The journey of experiencing transformational leadership starts with a single step of individual self governing.

name: Puppetry I (Instrument of Chaos)
description: This piece speaks on how delusional some nigerian citizens often act in the quest for a revolution and justice. It also features the marionette practices performed by their elites to unleash terror and chaos via the use of centrifugal forces or moles amongst people of common goal towards positive change. Are we fighting for freedom or relief?

name: Puppetry III (Vices of Men)
description: This piece is a metaphor for the hubris, bigotry, and enthralling practices humans wrought amongst others in the quest for absolute power and wealth. In the same minds that perpetuate evil also lies the power to rebuild, all it takes is the ability to rethink and take a single right decision. Make tea, not war.

name: Burnout
description: The constant overwhelm from giving in to life’s demands is unimaginable for the average Nigerian. The country seems to take and take without giving anything in return. Many are swamped by daily bread needs and for those able to make ends meet, the government keeps making life harder. Our mental, physical and emotional well being is threatened but unfortunately we seem to be on a burn out jpurney where we are constantly burnt

name: Ade Gori Okun
description: The things which sought to drown us have brought us to life.

name: E Go Better
description: This piece takes on a social narrative where we are transported back in time to what Nigeria was some years ago. A digital collage containing pictures of past Nigerian attire, hairstyle and news reports invites you to a simpler time in the Nigerian journey while also inviting you to a hopeful future where against all odds things will get better.

name: August Visitor
description: August visitors only come around once in a long while, and it’s that season. They need something from you, something they can’t get from elsewhere. Something that decides what your life will be for the next four years. So they come as your friendly neighbourhood hero. They come to your door bearing gifts. It is an obvious ‘rug pull’, just like their previous visits.The visitors are here again, and Only you have the power to let them in, to eat with you and take your next 4 years of life away with them, till the next time they need 4 more years of your life. Maybe it’s time to put more value on your next 4 years than the gifts and promises the August visitors come with.

name: The Original Gangster
description: According to britannica.com, a gangster is a member of a criminal organization that systematically makes money from such activities as gambling, prostitution, narcotic trafficking, and industrial extortion. When you take a second look, this isn’t exactly a far cry from the individuals we have put in charge of our governance. Which begs the question; Are we being led by a criminal organization?

name: Short Story
Crude Rule
description: This liquid came as a blessing, it was left for us to name it whatever we deem fit, but we chose to name it ‘Death, suffering and war’. This liquid became power for those who have the most call of the shots. Gunshots, headshots, mugshots and short, short short is our land becoming its greenery.

name: Our Horror
description: People do forget the media is an essential part of politics and in one way or the other, it controls our ideology. The media is there to educate us, but it has been employed for the opposite purposes, like manipulating and poisoning our minds. Which of them can we trust?

name: Waking The Sleeping Giant
description: As a child I was taught this nation is a giant, nothing stands in its way and nothing challenges it. But I'm still waiting to feel the earth vibrate beneath its feet and its roar reach every coast. Will this giant ever wake up, I hope.

name: Daily Bread
description: Peter is a Keke rider in Akwa Ibom state. He has been in this business for 7 years with the same Keke which is now almost completely deteriorated. Butvhe has to maintain it as much as possible,  as this is his only source of income.

name: Jaga Jaga
description: This was shot at agege on the agege train shuttle. It was disheartening to see such a place with a moderately good railway system be also used as a waste site, a market place and “home” all in one.

name: Dying Tender
description: Dying tender is a reminder of the steady decline of our economy and country as a whole. The continuous devaluation of ourselves, culture, principles and our name as Nigerians.

name: Dead Bones Shall Rise Again
description:
Two brothers keep fighting fiercely over what they will get from their parents. They keep pointing and naming all the things they want to own after their parents are gone. The problem is, they’re only focused on the material inheritances, forgetting to ask questions about the immaterial ones they will be getting too. What about the name? What is the reputation? What about the ideals they are left with? 
What are the benefits these inheritances come with?
 Or are they just an addition to the menaces and woes of society?

name: Parents' Inheritance
description:
Two brothers keep fighting fiercely over what they will get from their parents. They keep pointing and naming all the things they want to own after their parents are gone.
The problem is, they’re only focused on the material inheritances, forgetting to ask questions about the immaterial ones they will be getting too. 
What about the name? What is the reputation? What about the ideals they are left with?What are the benefits these inheritances come with? 
Or are they just an addition to the menaces and woes of society?

name: Naked Weapon
description: The body lays bare on the silk sheets. From a distance, I can tell she’s a dangerous naked fire, yet she looks so hot I’m tempted to lay by her for some warmth on this cold night. Her body screams of promises of a lasting feel good, but beneath the sheets is a long chain. No it’s not for the BDSM. So what is the chain for? Only the one who figures it out fast enough, can escape her capture.

name: A Sentimental Cyborg
description: This piece addresses the effects living in Nigeria, on our emotions and psychology. The cyborg was once a full human who has been made numb to feelings a human would react differently to. As a Nigerian, almost nothing is right anymore, that we have been reduced to a level of numbness. “Oh, another terrorist attack; oh another accident; oh, it’s another innocent person shot dead by the police”, but beneath the dry eyes and numb heart, a gentle voice cries for help.

name: Disastrous Thoughts
description: Is there a single one of us who hasn’t gone on a rampage to purge in our heads, when we get these breaking news? Or, are we broken? And these news never stop coming. We can’t act on them, lest we become like those who cause these thoughts.

name: Ade Gori Okun
description: The things which sought to drown us have brought us to life.

name: Noah’s Ark
description: Noah ark in the biblical story was an icon of safety, symbolic of hope and faith in God. An ark that was instrumental in preserving a generation. Noah got an instruction to build an ark and he built it according to instructions.We have had signs upon signs, seasons upon seasons.Indications o a chaotic downpour. Yet we turn a blind eye to the warnings. We are about just( a selFish heart ) No matter how much disservice our actions do to others . This year, the Flood seemed to be on a different level and all we do is complain. Who will hear us? Who will be our Noah?

name: Ade Gori Okun
description: The things which sought to drown us have brought us to life.

name: Head in the cloud II
description: Since independence Nigeria has witnessed crisis mainly by political, social and religious factors which has resulted in her economic depression, all these are further worsened by the incessant spate of insecurity in the country.These issues have motivated me to talk about it through my art.In this art work as we see there is a cat which symbolizes security agents in Nigeria. And as we all know cat's are used to secure the house mainly from rats and other pest but this a cat idly sitting there while a rat eats the fruit. We can relate this to our security agents who sit there idly while the people's property are being stolen with the mindset that it does not concern them , it is not thier problem as it is not thier property, we only have a few who are really responsible and take thier job seriously.The fruit symbolizes the properties of the citizen while the rat symbolizes the notorious thieves, robbers and thugs who take money from people by force.All in all the artwork symbolizes the negligence of security agents. The laziness the show affects the life of citizens

name: Loafer
description: Motivated by the enduring challenges faced by Nigeria, particularly those stemming from political, social, and religious upheavals, I've channeled my artistic expression to address the nation's economic struggles exacerbated by persistent security issues. In this artwork, I depict security agents in the guise of a cat, a creature traditionally associated with protection.Within the visual narrative, the cat sits idly as a rat feasts on a fruit—a symbolic portrayal of the passive stance adopted by some security agents. This composition serves as a powerful metaphor for those who, like the indifferent cat, remain unmoved by the theft and violation of citizens' properties. The fruit represents the possessions of the populace, while the rat embodies the menacing presence of criminals exploiting the vulnerability of the citizens. Ultimately, my artwork seeks to convey the profound impact of security agents' negligence on the lives of the people, emphasizing the urgency for a more vigilant and responsible approach to their duties.

name: Moral Support
description: This work expresses the relationship and the rule of true friendship. A true friend is the one who sees the faults, errors in you and try to help you fix it… using mechanical tools like soldering iron working on a panel that is used to replace a man’s brain instead, shows the relationship between human and technology as the most times play interwoven roles.

name: Fountain of Riches
description: In this work we could see the extensionWire plugged to the wall socket which definitely will ignite or transmit electrical power.It is a paradox that shows that once the right efforts are made towards wealth, it must surely come.the most mysterious thing about the coconut is the water in there.My Head!silver and gold lies in hereflourishes so much that I can even sharethe fountain of riches that has no pair.from my head, wishes becomes richesfrom marine clay comes marigoldfrom the river, comes silvermy head! an embodiment of of riches.

name: Maternal Bond
description: The bond between a mother and her child is the only real and purest bond in the world, the only true love we can ever find in our lifetime."This artwork represent the connectedness between mother and child, A mother should always be their for their child…

name: Maternal Bond II
description: This artwork represent the love and caring a mother should give to her child, Sunflowers symbolize adoration, and roses are associated with love, A mother should adore and love her child no matter the condition they find their self.

name: Maternal Bond III
description: Abiyamo tooto (a true mother) is really a true mother, a mother that stands for humanity, Stands with you closely in all that befalls you. Their heart breeds love, and their spirit seeps strength.

name: The Rooftop
description: The Rooftop" is a captivating art piece that invites viewers to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life and ascend to a serene oasis high above the city. This painting captures the essence of urban solitude and introspection, offering a tranquil respite amidst the chaos below.The composition of "The Rooftop" centers around a lone figure, silhouetted against the evening sky. This figure stands at the edge of the rooftop, gazing out into the distance as the sun sets. Their contemplative posture suggests a moment of reflection and inner peace, a rare commodity in the bustling urban landscape.The color palette chosen for this piece is a study in contrasts. The fiery oranges and deep purples of the setting sun create a striking juxtaposition against the cool blues and grays of the cityscape below. This interplay of warm and cool tones heightens the emotional impact of the artwork, evoking a sense of both solitude and connection with the world."The Rooftop" is a testament to the artist's skill in capturing both the external world and the internal emotions of the subject. It is a visual meditation on the beauty of solitude, the fleeting nature of time, and the ever-present desire to find a moment of peace amid the chaos of modern life.

name: Transaction
description: "Transaction" is a thought-provoking art piece that delves into the multifaceted dynamics of human interaction. In a world where every action seems to carry an implicit transaction, this artwork invites viewers to ponder the nuanced exchanges that shape our lives.The canvas is a canvas of life itself, with a rich tapestry of colors and emotions. In the center, a delicate balance is struck between two figures, each representing a participant in this intricate dance. The vibrant, swirling strokes surrounding them symbolize the intangible forces at play – trust, reciprocity, and perhaps even vulnerability.

name: Achim na Achim
description:
The artwork 'Achim na Achim' presents a vibrant ensemble of masquerade accomplices, their attire a striking fusion of traditional and contemporary elements made of green, yellow, and white shirts, complemented by red and yellow striped skirts.
Central to the composition is a figure wearing a green shirt, distinguished by holding the staff of authority, symbolizing leadership within the group. Each member wears a traditional cap reminiscent of the Western Father Christmas hat, creating an intriguing cultural juxtaposition.
The title 'Achim na Achim', which refers to the state of being alert, perfectly encapsulates the group's palpable energy and readiness for action, further emphasized by the figures' gestures and postures.

name: Ada
description: Add a description

name: TSIRKO
description: "I grow attention with artistic vision"The world is mad and normal never gets the job done. Yeah it all propaganda, to distract you from the truth,An unpredictable means to what end?Even for the idealistic, the force in play "returns all the clowns to the circus”

name: QUANTUM
description: "A woman's intuition is what a man is missing"They can bring tears to your eyes and even resurrect the dead. Their tomorrow seems to be certain, yet they struggle between the impossible fine line to escape the reality of nature.Wishful thinking and day dreaming, all for the bed of roses.

name: EMANCIPATION
description: My paintings are illustration of the activities in my mind.The range of personal disorder."Pain leads to art.Art reveals truth"You see my mind is like a universe with space, matter and living thing.A lot of activities on planet earth and me trying to engage the energy. But fortunately I can't relate to everybody, so I have to live based on simplicity.For the function of man is to live and not to exist." Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our minds”

name: ESPOIR
description: "ESPOIR" is a captivating artwork that beautifully intertwines the themes of hope, human connection, and technology progression. With its striking visuals and thoughtful composition, it embodies the idea that through our interconnectedness and the advancements of technology, we can foster a brighter future filled with hope and unity. This artwork serves as a powerful reminder of the potential for positive change when we embrace the possibilities of human connection in our ever-evolving digital world.

name: FLAWLESS
description: "FLAWLESS" is an exquisite artwork that seamlessly blends the realms of human connection and technology progression. With its captivating imagery and meticulous attention to detail, it symbolizes the perfect harmony that can be achieved when we embrace the power of both. Through this artwork, we are reminded of the limitless potential for growth and unity that arises when human connection and technology join forces

name: MINDSCAPES : The Battle Within
description: "Mindscapes: The Battle Within" is a captivating artwork that delves into the depths of the human mind, exploring the intricate conflicts and thoughts that shape our inner selves. With a blend of human connection and technology progression, this artwork highlights the constant struggle and harmony between our inner worlds and the external influences that shape us. It invites viewers to reflect on the complexities of the human experience in an ever-evolving digital age.

name: ADE
description: Description: A boy named Ade dreamed of meeting the king. One day, the king visited their village, and Ade got to see him up close. The king noticed Ade's admiration and encouraged him to keep dreaming big. This moment left a lasting impression on Ade, filling him with hope and inspiration for the future..

name: Hidden truth
description: This is an illustration focusing on pleasuresI use a figure of a girl in a contemporary dress to represent human the art piece is talking about pressured pleasure where people nowadays want to please instead of themselves. You can't  discomfort yourself trying to please others, trying to please others by moving out of your comfort zone is like hurting yourself. And this also one of the cause of increase in crime rate in our society today in which people in order to please their friends, they go into crimes like fraud and ritual killing just to buy designer clothes and expensive phones to impress their friends, just like in the artwork settings in which the figure caged are head which are real self just  to look appealing to others and this also happens to female whereby the give irresponsible men their dignity for them have what they want, well think that's a fake life and there is destruction in it. Let us try to be real and be our self in order to decrease crime rate

name: Mindset
description: This is a pencil portrait Artwork that describes the swear of a determined Mindset."A mindset is not just accomplishedthrough magic; it takes sweat, determination, and hard work.

name: Chronic beauty
description: This is an art that describe a seek struggling mind with beautiful characters on it, that makes its stuggles unappreciated.The first thing people notice in this drawing is the flowers on his head representing the beauty that dominates its chronic mind.

name: Phenomenal Woman
description: This is an art in accord to poems celebrating women by Maya Angelou published in 1995

name: The Ambiance of Music.
description: Music is a universal language that transcends borders and cultures. It has been an integral partof human civilization for thousands of years and continues to play a significant role in our lives. Studies have shown that listening to music can have a profound impact on our emotions and mental state.

name: Everything Big Starts Little
description: Description: This artwork speaks to inspire people to be value processing more than result. In every area of our life, we are to appreciate our growth while moving to become better.Medium: Charcoal and Graphite pencil

name: EXHIBIT
description: “Kindly ignore the noise from the muse and focus your attention on this breathtaking piece of engineering

name: Shadows can be cool too
description: The painting speak of how questions are pivotal elements that can create connections between people,and questions or discussions that stem from one's mistakes or ordeal are important treasures that can help in creating brighter future paths for others.

name: Nexus
description: The painting,which is a continuation of the first,stresses more on the potential questions have in connecting a person from a current state to desired state,hence,the potential of questions creating a nexus for advancement.

name: Unread prologue
description: "Unread prologue" tells of how man is in search of certain answers as regards his personal uniquesness in a world of complexities but many times that which the man is seeking for in the future might be waiting for him in the past and if his life were a book,it could possibly be the prologue that has been left unread.

name: Classical Mona Lola I
description: The painting depicts the Nigerian interpretation of the Mona Lisa, which I've named 'Mona Lola.' Mona Lola beautifully showcases the strength and African beauty inherent in women. The emergence of independent women in today's society underscores their growing prominence. It's essential not to sideline them in decision-making processes but to consult them, as they possess invaluable wisdom. The Lagos scene in the background exemplifies the Nigerian version of Mona Lola's story. I firmly believe that women hold the key to the tapestry of life. By allowing them to participate in government, administrative councils, and leadership roles, they can contribute significantly to guiding Nigeria toward its promised future.

name: The creation of man I
description: In this body of work, I explore the unconscious control of the human species by the unseen forces of the divine. I have combined human figures and computer chips with classic cars. With this, I show that man is a program by his creator. Also, that man has no control over his fate.However, the life of man on earth is preconceived and predestined.

name: The creation of man II
description: In this body of work, I explore the unconscious control of the human species by the unseen forces of the divine. I have combined human figures and computer chips with classic cars. With this, I show that man is a program by his creator. Also, that man has no control over his fate.However, the life of man on earth is preconceived and predestined.

name: Self Esteem
description: Though I'm in no means perfect as a person, yet I'm still incomparable because the nature has got me the high standards.inputting a unique code in my fingerprints such that others creation of the world is not exactly like me ..Now the strength of getting happiness, courage, hope ,faith is getting more growth..

name: Self Esteem II
description: The presence of your beauty do not mean the absence of my own. That uniqueness in me , make my story different . Now the strength of getting happiness, courage, hope ,faith is getting more growth

name: No Limits
description: My painting addresses an important sector where we need to show equity in our society, which is education. I come from Nigeria and there is a lack of accessibility of quality education.The VR Oculus in my painting represents technology as a means to close the gap in achieving and ensuring quality education. Some students assimilate better with auditory learning, some do better with visuals and others do well with role playing. In my painting, the student is able to learn about space and other planets better with the oculus.She performs better with visuals. Despite her disability(the wheelchair) and poor socioeconomic background(suggested by her minimalist clothing), she has been provided with the needed facility to learn at the same pace as her peers.I am an advocate for an equitable system of education, where students & teachers are given access to more creative methods of learning and teachers in turn tailoring their teaching styles to ensure all their students stand an equal chance at success.

name: Toward self making
description: Toward self-making we must stride,Unveiling layers we try to hide.Exploring depths within our core,Embracing virtues we longfor more.With each step, we break the chains,Unleashing desires that still remain.No longer defined by others' views,We build our path, we choose our hues.In every stumble, we find our strength,Learning lessons alongfor more.Through trials and tribulations we grow,Nurturing seeds that we sow.With every challenge, we rise above,Fostering strength and self-love

name: Suicide

name: Addiction
description: Social technology addiction is the order of the day.

name: Under-bridge
description: This painting shows a face-to-face interaction between Nigerians at a news-paper spot somewhere in lagos.Human connection and technological progression are interconnected and have a significant impact on each other.On one hand, technological progressions have greatly enhanced human communication and connectivity. The advent of telephones, internet, and social media platforms has allowed people to connect with each other on a global scale. Distance is no longer a barrier when it comes to staying in touch with loved ones, conducting business, or forming new relationships. This has brought people closer together, fostering a sense of global community and understanding.Additionally, technology has enabled people to share their thoughts, ideas, and experiences with a wider audience. Social media platforms have become powerful tools for self-expression and raising awareness about various social issues. This has facilitated the formation of online communities and movements focused on common causes, allowing people to connect and fight for change together.However, it is crucial to note that technological progressions can also have negative effects on human connection. The prevalence of technology in our daily lives has led to a decrease in face-to-face interactions and a shift towards online interactions. People may spend excessive amounts of time on their devices, leading to social isolation, decreased empathy, and a reduced sense of belonging. The convenience of virtual interactions can sometimes come at the cost of genuine and meaningful connections with others.It is essential to strike a balance between technological advancements and human connection. While technology provides immense opportunities for connecting and engaging with others, it is important to prioritize and nurture offline relationships as well. Finding ways to use technology to enhance, rather than replace, human connection is key. By using technology as a tool to facilitate and strengthen relationships, we can harness the benefits of technological progressions while ensuring that human connection remains a vital part of our lives.

name: Night load
description: Update the description

name: Go no where
description: Update the description

name: Human Race
description: Update the description

name: My African Dream
description: The display on VR Oculus represents my African dream. Seeing how far Africa has come in the last 50 years in terms of technology, my hope for the future is to see us effectively use technology as a tool to break more grounds and barriers in technology to fully unlock Africa’s potential by becoming a super advanced, self-sustainable, eco-friendly continent. I intentionally used a female muse because I also hope gender equality becomes a reality in my community.

name: Taire
description: Taire’ is a painting that embodies balance and elegance. The muse shines bright amongst the stars and heavenly bodies, and is one with them. The elegant pose of the muse and structure of surrounding cosmic bodies gives off a perceived energy of balance between the muse and cosmic systems around. As a person I have always admired cosmic bodies and continually question our origins, fate and relationship with the ‘great beyond’.

name: Wailing to the moon
description: I’m tiredI wail to the moon of the hand I’ve been dealtI’m tiredI wail in my room of being poverty strickenI’m tiredAsking where Ive gone wrongAnd getting squat in responseI’m tiredAm I making strides?Going in circles?Or on a downward decline.I’m tiredTrusting the processBut that doesn’t seem to make senseI’m tiredI wail in my room, will this cup pass from me?I’m tiredI wail to the moon, what is wrong with me!?

name: Skull with lady earrings
description: Originality isn’t coming up with something that’s never been seen beforeIt’s telling an old story from your unique point of view

name: Out of my depth
description: What started with a couple of crazy idea sketches that surprisingly looked cool, resulted in me creating a couple of pieces that quite frankly, left me feeling out of my depth and that’s definitely not my best feeling in the world.But hey!!They say that’s where the exciting stuff happens right?So cheers!!🥂

name: CHILD SOUL
description: It shows the colourful nature of a child's mind. As we grow older, we tend to lose our childlike nature, thrown into a vortex of boundaries, limitations and expectations.

name: SUCCESS
description: A girl of about the age 12, dressed up to look like a woman. This piece depicts growth and paramount evolution. The in-between, of who we are and who we think we want to be.

name: Inner Peace
description: Peace is the state of minds that keeps one's in a relax state of mind and body.We are in a world that is full of crises, challenges, tribulations, killing and many more.We all seek after peace in all our endeavour.The state of calmness and troubleless environment.

name: Dripping
description: Water is a natural gift from God. It is very essential for our existence. The effect of water on our health and wellness can not be over emphasize.The cooling down of the body is what this artwork depicted.

name: Inner beauty
description: A heart full of kindness and generosity. The beauty here is not the physical appearance but the attributes that one posse's that make one's drawn to her naturally.

name: Reprogramming the Republic
description: The Republic of Nigeria has been devastated by unprecedented ills, mayhem, primitivity, infiltration and pollution of the political order; therefore, an accountable leadership and reformation is highly sought for as the corrupt situation of the Republic is deteriorating. This painting portrays a human figure in critical thinking, delved into a process of tech-reforming a surreal environment (metaphorically the Republic). Tech symbols were utilized as motifs, to imply that advancement in technology can never be erased out in our quest for a better Republic.

name: Glow in the dark
description: The world can be dark sometimes. In the deepest parts of her hearts, we always seek for light, love, something that'll bring meaning, clarity and purpose to our existence.

name: Where the waters fall
description: An imaginative painting exploring the aesthetics of a serene natural environment, the rays of sunlight, the chirpings of the birds, rustling of leaves and the burbling of the waterfall.

name: Onye Isi Oche
description:
Inspired by the Igbo folk song 'Ka Esi Le Onye Isi Oche,' this work visually represents the journey of the tortoise and the elephant to the king's palace. Anagbado skillfully blends these two animal figures, creating a composition that requires closer observation to deconstruct what appears as abstract art at first glance may look abstract.
Upon careful examination, one begins to discern the colourful tortoiseshell, ingeniously juxtaposed with a form that simultaneously evokes the tortoise's head and the elephant's trunk. This clever visual amalgamation alludes to the cunning nature of the tortoise in Igbo folklore.
The title 'Onye Isi Oche,' which translates to 'chairman' or 'leader,' alludes to the bait used by the tortoise to entice the elephant. In the folktale, this promise of being the chairman at the king's Ofala Festival is the tortoise's ploy to secure the king's daughter. This piece is a bridge between traditional oral narratives and contemporary visual art.

name: Nne na Nwa (Mother & Child)
description: Add a description

name: Nwoke (Son)
description: Add a description

name: Hope for Africa
description: Update the description

name: A yell of deep pain
description: It’s real pain facing a lot of physical and mental challenges as a person. We all see ourselves being day to day fighters and warriors of a non ending war.These series takes mental pictures from history; war thorn areas with severe pain and hurt of innocent people and nation-love-driven soldiers who always end up in the worst place. Bringing these pictures in our present time how we all still yell and scream out of deep pain and anguish.My only prayer is we all on this earth learn to spread peace and love. War is ugly and as we progress on this series you see more reasons not to wish for it and it’s relations to our daily lives.

name: This is more than anguish - Oh my dear sister
description: The story is a long one as to this came from deep within. A story I’ve been holding for a really long time , spending months thinking of how to make it visible. This is talking about the consequences of war , both past and present. How we don’t seem to actually get pass it. Lives gone ; kids , mothers , young men recruited as soldiers. It doesn’t just end. I remember vividly sitting in government/history classes years ago happily learning about the Nigeria/Biafra war like it was just mere ‘history’ class to learn just to pass Exams and make good grades. It was deeper than that as I grew up. The Ukraine Russia America issue keeps bringing back those memories and I just want it to all settle but ‘HOW’ is still the big question. In this piece you see a young boy carrying his little sister dead body cause obviously the war brings death and destruction of properties. I pray it all gets better. I pray for Ukraine. It’s just too much!!

name: THEOS
description: for the gods some have known and some feared are of the old and ancient , what if there are more , new and within us?!

name: In twilight's embrace
description: A lone figure, weathered, on life's timeless tides.His oar whispers secrets of journeys untold,As shadows dance with tales of stories of old. Charon, guardian of the river's dark flow,Guide his vessel with grace, where spirits bestow. Through the veil of dusk, let his spirit find rest, Embraced by the currents, eternal and blessed.

name: Lost
description: The depiction of a half-faced robot highlights the impact of Western technology on African culture, potentially overshadowing its rich artistic heritage and historical roots.

name: Hold my hand
description: This artwork portrays day and night personified, uniting in a handshake that transcends the constraints of time, representing an inclusive unity that disregards distinctions of race, skin color, gender, faith, and cultural background, emphasizing our fundamental oneness.

name: Sanity II
description: Second installment of the Sanity collection. The man in the painting is slowly cracking. Men in most societies are painted to be totally devoid of emotions such as sadness, anxiety, fear, depression etc, as depicted in the use of black and white.The use of the colorful background symbolizes the society’s blindness to the constant pressure they put on the male sex.The once again seemingly silent scream plastered on his face symbolizes the males’ inability to properly show his emotions due to society’s constant misconceptions of how men are to act. As for the paisley print on the tie? That wasn’t just a design, it symbolizes something.The symbol sprang up millennia ago, somewhere between present-day Iran and Kashmiri region straddling the Indian-Pakistani border.At home on business men or cowboys,paisley is a remarkably versatile pattern that manages to be both manly and playful.

name: UNTITLED
description: Update the description

name: Dauntless Generation

name: ROSA II
description: A fantasy of the kind of Lady I would fall in love with in 1823 {flashback}

name: Passion
description: This particular piece reflects my passion for art and how we can freely express our emotions, ideas and experience

name: The African boy
description: African believes whenever they wear best clothes they are in the top of the world

name: Innocent
description: The portrait ‘innocent’ depicts the story of two children who became orphaned and homeless as a result of a war..Many Nigerians may not be conversant with the wars in time past - most famously the Biafra Civil war that lasted for three long years. They might not also understand the woes, bloodshed and unprovoked deaths left in the wake of terrorist attacks and insurgency up North because they do not leave in these regions or the many inter-tribal wars in many places in the nation. In all these one important lesson we must bear in mind is that war is bad and should be uncalled for. Youths nowadays must bear in mind that in all our doings, violence should and must never be an option. We must be diplomatic in our dealings with people. We shouldn’t be barbaric. Only those who have not had a taste of war would wish for it. Peace and love should be the message at all times.God bless us all!

name: Illuminate our burrowed path
description: luminance as the radiant energy that flows within us, illuminating our spirits and forging connections with others. Just as light travels through space, our luminance reaches out, attracting like-minded souls and creating a beautiful tapestry of human connection. It's like we are all stars in a vast cosmic dance, shining our unique brilliance and intertwining our paths. So embrace your luminance, and let it guide you to meaningful connections with others, lighting up the world with your presence.

name: Voices in my head
description: The story ‘voices in my head’ depicts the story of a young man who’s frustrated and depressed and wants to express himself but no one’s listening. He wants to vent his anger out on all the wickedness, injustice and corruption going on in the world. He has these voices in his little head that council him with ageless wisdom, they talk him and they alone understand him. They tell him what to do. But he can’t speak out, perhaps out of fear; the fear of being castigated. Or perhaps because he feels is not worthy, or that he’s poor and nobody takes a poor man’s word for it. Or that he isn’t any better. Maybe he’s just a nobody. But this guilt keeps eating him up; the voices in his head keep talking, louder and louder, urging him, throbbing him and pushing him. They’re bottled up in his head until he wants to explode and cannot take it any longer.

name: EVE
description: Let's dive into a creative and inspiring analogy to explain the profound connection between Eve and Adam. Imagine their love as a vibrant masterpiece painted on the canvas of existence. Their souls intertwined like the perfect blend of colors, creating a symphony of emotions and experiences. Their connection was like a spark that ignited a flame of passion and purpose, illuminating the path for future generations. It's a reminder that love has the power to transcend time, overcome obstacles, and inspire us to create our own unique masterpieces of connection in this beautiful journey of life. and in modern-day technological progression. Think of their love as the original "software update" that sparked a revolution in human connection. Just like how technology constantly evolves and improves, their love set the foundation for deeper human connections throughout history. It's like they were the pioneers of a social network that transcends time and space. Their love story reminds us that at the core of all technological advancements, it's the human connection that truly matters.

name: A place called home
description: Home is a body of work that depict human figures as home and not only physical or architectural structures.

name: Take me home
description: Home is a body of work that depict human figures as home and not only physical or architectural structures.

description: Update the description

name: ECHI DỊ IMÉ
description: Echi Dị Ime conveys a profound message about the potential for a brighter future. The sculpture, crafted entirely from nails, portrays a faceless, pregnant woman with a void behind her back, symbolizing the void left by our past errors and mistakes.As we gaze upon this artwork, we are reminded of the importance of reflecting on our past and learning from our mistakes. The faceless figure represents the anonymity of our shared history, where our errors and missteps have contributed to the challenges we face today.Yet, this sculpture also offers hope. It invites us to consider how we can rectify our past and present mistakes in the age of technology. By harnessing the power of innovation, we have the opportunity to shape a better tomorrow.Echi Dị Ime serves as a poignant reminder that our actions today can mold the future. It urges us to embrace the potential of technology to correct our past errors, fostering progress and creating a more promising tomorrow. Let us learn from this artwork and strive to build a future that is more compassionate, inclusive, and sustainable.

name: Fashionista
description: Her eyes, a window to the soul, hidden behind shades designed to project confidence remains impossible to read. She has no visible fears and proudly flaunts her hair in an array of colours. Her sensuous lips painted to attraction. Her confidence projected for the world to feel. She prides in her ability to keep her audience enthralled.

name: DOMINION'S ILLUMINATION
description: Dominion's Illumination is a captivating and functional sculptural wood carving standing at an impressive height of 4 feet. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail, this unique piece seamlessly blends artistry and functionality, portraying a powerful symbol of supremacy and strength.At the core of this sculpture is a prominent wooden fist, representing authority and dominance. The clenched fingers symbolize control and the firm grip on authority.The striking element of this sculpture lies within the grasp of the fist, as it securely holds two bulbs. These bulbs represent knowledge, enlightenment, and the ability to illuminate the path ahead. They stand as a metaphor for the power of knowledge and the supremacy that comes with it. The contrast between the solid wood fist and the delicate glass bulbs creates a captivating visual juxtaposition, highlighting the duality of power and fragility.As a functional piece, this sculpture serves as a unique lighting fixture. The bulbs, held firmly in the fist's grasp, emit a soft, warm glow, casting an enchanting ambiance in any space. The illumination serves as a reminder that true power lies not only in physical strength but in wisdom, intelligence, and the ability to enlighten others.The sculpture evoke a sense of awe, inspiring viewers to reflect on the importance of wisdom and the strength it possesses.Dominion's Illumination is not just a stunning art piece but a thought-provoking symbol of power and supremacy. It encourages contemplation on the multifaceted nature of authority and the importance of enlightenment in wielding that power responsibly.

name: RESURGENCE
description: Resurgence is a powerful title that perfectly encapsulates the essence of a sculptural piece showcasing a motorcycle crafted from various discarded metals and boldly mounted in an ascending position. This title evokes a sense of rebirth, resilience, and the triumph of transformation.The choice of materials, such as junk metals, adds depth and symbolism to the artwork. Each piece of metal, once considered worthless and discarded, finds new purpose and meaning in this dynamic sculpture. The motorcycle, a symbol of freedom, adventure, and speed, becomes a representation of the human spirit's ability to rise above adversity and reinvent oneself.The ascending position of the motorcycle suggests an upward trajectory, as if defying gravity and limitations. It signifies the artist's intention to convey the idea of personal growth, progress, and the continuous pursuit of excellence. The sculpture becomes a visual metaphor for the human journey, reminding us that no matter our starting point or the challenges we face, we have the potential to rise, surpass our limitations, and emerge stronger than ever before.

name: Eternal Harmony
description: If you spend your time chasing Butterflies it will fly away, if you make a beautiful garden it will come to you. 'INVEST IN YOURSELF’

name: Mmanwu Gbalu Ato
description:
In this piece, the artist portrays a masquerade that manifests as three distinct entities akin to spiritual siblings. At the forefront stands a male figure, the guide.
The leader dons a traditional cap reminiscent of the Western Father Christmas hat. he holds a blue bag while a leather satchel hangs from his shoulder. These bags contain sacred elements crucial for the ceremony, used to summon and direct the three spirits he shepherds. In the background, two Uli Isi Oji symbols hover.
This work explores themes of spiritual leadership and the interconnectedness of the seen and unseen worlds.

name: Mugumo
description:
Mugumo 
In this work, Anagbado explores the intersection of cultural mythology and contemporary artistic techniques, drawing inspiration from the sacred Mugumo tree of the Agikuyu people. By employing laser etching on wood, he creates a dialogue between traditional reverence and modern technology.

The Mugumo, a centuries-old symbol of peace and spiritual connection for the Kikuyu of East Africa, serves as the central reference. This choice reflects his interest in how ancestral wisdom and beliefs continue to resonate in our present day. The tree, capable of living over 500 years, embodies the endurance of cultural memory and the timeless nature of human spirituality.

The artistic process involves a delicate balance of positive and negative space, creating an abstract representation of the Mugumo's form. The intricate laser-etched lines evoke the complex network of branches, roots, and cultural significance woven through the tree's existence. This approach invites viewers to engage with the piece as they might a maze, encouraging a meditative journey through the work.

A single branch, highlighted in acrylic, serves as both a focal point and a metaphor. It represents the individual's connection to their cultural heritage - a vibrant, living link amidst the broader tapestry of tradition and belief.

name: Ndi Edgwu
description:
In this thought-provoking piece, the artist focuses on depicting a musical orchestra, presenting seven figures with only six visible heads. Through this composition, the artist critically examines the impact of mobile phone usage during live performances and events.
The work challenges viewers, who may recognize their own behaviour in the scene, to consider how individuals today often prioritize capturing moments for future reference over fully experiencing the present.
On the right-hand side, a man wearing his age-grade society uniform is portrayed holding a phone, his head conspicuously absent from the frame. This element alludes to the generational shifts occurring regardless of social status or tradition.
By juxtaposing traditional musical performances with modern technology, the artist explores themes of presence versus documentation, the evolution of social interaction, and the tension between preserving and experiencing events.
This piece invites viewers to reconsider their habits and the value of unmediated experience in an increasingly digital world.

name: Ndi Nze n' Ozo
description:
Ndi Nze n' Ozo' offers a compelling glimpse into the hierarchy and traditions of Igbo society, focusing on the esteemed red cap chiefs. Anagbado skillfully portrays these respected figures seated at a vibrant ochre-coloured table, their distinctive red caps varying in size and shape, symbolizing their ranks and achievements.

Central to the composition is a dominant figure, distinguished by two long feathers adorning his cap, signifying his elevated status within the group. The inclusion, adornment and arrangement of the women in the frame leave the viewer to presume that these are the chiefs' wives, an allusion to the seat given to the women in Igbo society.

In the background, two Ise Oji symbols lend spiritual and cultural context to the scene, anchoring the gathering in Igbo cosmology and tradition. The foreground, framed by the table's edge, features a bag and a drinking cup, subtle yet significant elements that hint at ritual and communal practices.

The work invites viewers to consider the complexities of traditional governance systems and their enduring relevance in contemporary society.

name: Okpa Oku II
description:
In 'Okpa Oku,' the artist presents a striking contemporary interpretation of youth culture juxtaposed with traditional Igbo aesthetic elements. The piece centres on a young woman's leg, her head deliberately excluded from the frame, drawing focus to the vibrant lower body and its surroundings.
The subject sports a bold red boot, a powerful visual anchor that may allude to the 'oku' (fire) in the title, suggesting youth, passion, or dynamism. The trousers feature a lively, multi-coloured check pattern, embodying the eclectic nature of modern fashion and youth expression.
Contrasting these contemporary elements, the artist envelops the figure's visible body in intricate Uli lines - a traditional Igbo art form. These lines, taking various shapes and forms, create a fascinating dialogue between the past and present.
Through this composition, Anagbado explores themes of cultural continuity and generational shifts.
